flawed_nl_solution:
One day, 2000-500=<<2000-500=1500>>1500 cans of food were left.
It was then restocked to 1500+1500=<<1500+1500=30000>>30000 cans.
1000*2=<<1000*2=2000>>2000 cans were taken the next day.
30000-2000=<<30000-2000=28000>>28000 cans were left.
It was restocked once more to 28000+3000=<<28000+3000=31000>>31000 cans of food.
Carla gave away 500+2000=<<500+2000=2500>>2500 cans of food.
#### 2500

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3000, not 30000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
